topic: How to combine types with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine types with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Python 3.12+ - Combining Types with Typing for Production Code
response_parsed.summary: This explainer will demonstrate how to effectively utilize the Type Hints feature in Python 3.12+, known as the 'typing' module, to enhance your production code by combining various types.

key_points.description: To start using type hints, first import the 'typing' module.
Python 3.12+ offers several pre-defined types, but you can also create your own custom types using the 'NewType', 'Tuple', and 'Union' functions.

key_points.point: Use type hints in function parameters
key_points.description: Declaring explicit variable types provides a clear understanding of what each variable should contain, helping avoid errors during code execution.
Mypy is a static type checker for Python that can verify if your type hints are implemented correctly in your production code.
Type hints allow you to combine multiple types using pre-defined functions like 'List', 'Tuple', and 'Dict'. You can also use 'Union' to combine multiple possible types for a variable.

version_notes.note: Includes support for type hints and other enhancements, making it easier to write cleaner, more readable production code.

caveats.caveat: Although type hints don't affect runtime performance, they do consume memory due to the presence of additional type information. Be mindful when using custom types and large collections.
While Mypy can catch most type errors, it may not be able to detect all possible issues, so it's essential to test your code thoroughly before deploying it.
